WorkItem.ClosedComment: This would be addressed by addition of ES6 'template strings' which is tracked by suggestion http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/19.
WorkItem.Description:
I love this project, first of all.

 

I'm not finding support in the spec for multiline strings.  Couldn't it be the same as C#'s @"

.....

.......

......" multiline string literal support?

 

Or perhaps there is another answer to Google's Closure Templates?

 

Thanks!

Comments.Message:
I suggest using the 
"""
...
...
"""
syntax for mutliline strings rather than C#'s @". The former syntax allows you to use double quotes in the literal without any problems.
